usefulItems: frying pan, rolling pin, springform cake tin (Ø 26 cm), cling film, oven, hob, refrigerator
title: Sweet Potato Strudel with Spinach and Pine Nuts

ingredients.content: 370 g plain flour, plus extra for dusting
2 ½ tsp fine sea salt, plus extra to taste
600 g sweet potatoes, cut in pieces (2-3 cm)
½ tsp ground black pepper, plus extra to taste
15 g olive oil, plus extra for greasing

preparations.content: Place flour, oil, water, vinegar, egg and salt in mixing bowl then knead <b>2 min/<b>. Tip out, wrap in cling film and place in fridge for approx. 30 minutes.  Meanwhile, make filling.

Place water and ½ tsp salt in mixing bowl. Insert simmering basket and weigh in sweet potatoes. Place Varoma dish into position and weigh in 250 g spinach. Cover Varoma then steam <b>10 min/Varoma/speed 1<b>. Meanwhile, toast pine nuts in a dry frying pan until golden brown.
Add remaining 250 g spinach to Varoma dish, cover Varoma and steam <b>10 min/Varoma/speed 1<b>. Meanwhile, preheat oven to 180°C and grease a springform tin (Ø 26 cm).
Set Varoma aside. Remove simmering basket with aid of spatula and discard steaming water.
Place cooked sweet potatoes, 1½ tsp salt, pepper, cumin and garam masala in mixing bowl then purée <b>15 sec/speed 7<b>.
Place a bowl on mixing bowl lid and weigh in quark, soya milk and oil.  Remove bowl, add ½ tsp salt and mix.

On a well-floured surface, roll out chilled dough to a very thin, long rectangle (approx. 20 cm x 90 cm). Spread half the quark mixture the whole length of the rectangle in the middle then add sweet potato purée, steamed spinach and half the toasted pine nuts. Season with salt and pepper, to taste. Roll long edges over filling and squeeze ends together.

Gently shape log into a spiral and place in prepared tin. Top strudel with remaining quark mixture, sprinkle with black cumin seeds and remaining toasted pine nuts then bake for 45-50 minutes (180°C) until golden. Serve sweet potato strudel with vegan gravy (see tip).

hintsAndTricks: Find a recipe for a Vegan Gravy on Cookidoo.
